document_data.name: Flant Borlley
document_data.mainbody:
'''Flant Borlley''' was a commoner from the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''Lord Gortash will protect us all - even if you can't appreciate his genius.''|Flant Borlley}}
document_data.Description: Flant was a [[human]] man with facial [[tattoo]]s. He wore an azure-colored hood and commoner's garb.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, the city of Baldur's Gate was threatened by the encroaching army of the [[Cult of the Absolute]]. The crisis flooded the city with refugees, elevating tensions among its citizens and allowing a new power to take rulership of the city â€“ [[Lord Gortash]]. Flant Borlley eagerly consumed the new lord's propaganda from the curbside preachers and from the pages of the ''[[Baldur's Mouth]] Gazette.'' [[Augur Harxkellan]] was a Gortash loyalist whose words attracted Flant's attention as he worshiped Enver Gortash, thinking him to be an underappreciated genius.
